alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 1:32AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Montana and west central Montana, including the following areas, in northwest Montana, Flathead/Mission Valleys, Kootenai/Cabinet Region and West Glacier Region. In west central Montana, Lower Clark Fork Region. This includes the following Specific Areas... Kalispell, Hot Springs, Thompson Falls, Going-to-the-Sun Road in Glacier Park, Howe Ridge Fire Burn Area in Glacier Park and Boulder 2700 Fire Burn Area near Flathead Lake. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from rainfall may result in flooding of rivers, streams, and other low-lying and flood prone locations. Flooding may also occur in urban areas. Rock fall will also be a concern in the Glacier Park region. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A very moist and unstable atmosphere will be conducive to heavy rainfall across northwest Montana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; Lower Clark Fork Region; West Glacier Region
